Initially, enemy aliens were barred from serving in the regular British armed forces.
They were only allowed to join an auxiliary unit known as the Pioneer Corps.
The Pioneer Corps performed non-combatant tasks like trench-sticking, bridge-building
and clearing roads.

Six million Jews were murdered during the Holocaust.
They died in concentration camps like Bergen-Belsen and Theresienstadt.
They died in death camps like Auschwitz-Birkenau and Treblinka.
They were gassed, shot, starved, and succumbed to diseases like typhoid.
They were murdered for no other reason than because they were Jews.
In this podcast, we have explored the connections between the Holocaust and Wales.
We have listened to the stories of refugees who found sanctuary in Wales,
and the terrors from which they fled.
The Holocaust did not just happen to other people in another place and time.
It is part of all of our history.
By studying this history, we ensure that victims are not forgotten,
and hope to prevent the horrors of the Holocaust from ever being repeated.
